text.div:
ePI FHIR Capability Statement (draft 1)

This section describes a minumum expected capabilities of an ePI FHIR Server which is responsible for providing responses to the queries submitted by the ePI clients. Please refer to the XML or JSON versions of this specification for details on which elements search is to be enabled on. A compliant server SHALL adhere to the requirements listed in this resource, and implement the RESTful behavior according to the FHIR specification.

ModeSERVER
Description

A minumum functionality for ePI. Refer to the FHIR specification for further requirements, and the details in the computable version of this Capabiltiy Statement

Transactiony
System Historyy
System Searchy
Resource TypeProfileReadV-ReadSearchUpdateCreateUpdatesHistory

name: ePI FHIR Capability Statement (draft 1)
publisher: Vulcan Accelerator on behalf of the HL7 PC WG
description: This section describes a minumum expected capabilities of an ePI FHIR Server which is responsible for providing responses to the queries submitted by the ePI clients. Please refer to the XML or JSON versions of this specification for details on which elements search is to be enabled on. A compliant server SHALL adhere to the requirements listed in this resource, and implement the RESTful behavior according to the FHIR specification.

rest.documentation: A minumum functionality for ePI. Refer to the FHIR specification for further requirements, and the details in the computable version of this Capabiltiy Statement

security.description:
1. See the [General Security Considerations](security.html) section for requirements and recommendations.
1. A server **SHALL** reject any unauthorized requests by returning an `HTTP 401` "Unauthorized", `HTTP 403` "Forbidden", or `HTTP 404` "Not Found"

searchParam.name: identifier
searchParam.documentation: An identifier for the administrable product

searchParam.name: manufactured-item
searchParam.documentation: The manufactured item(s) that this administrable product is produced from. Either a single item, or several that are mixed before administration (e.g. a power item and a solution item). Note that these are not raw ingredients

searchParam.name: ingredient
searchParam.documentation: The ingredients of this administrable medicinal product

searchParam.name: route
searchParam.documentation: Coded expression for the route

searchParam.name: dose-form
searchParam.documentation: The administrable dose form, i.e. the dose form of the final product after necessary reconstitution or processing

searchParam.name: device
searchParam.documentation: A device that is integral to the medicinal product, in effect being considered as an "ingredient" of the medicinal product. This is not intended for devices that are just co-packaged

searchParam.name: form-of
searchParam.documentation: The medicinal product that this is an administrable form of. This is not a reference to the item(s) that make up this administrable form - it is the whole product

searchParam.name: target-species
searchParam.documentation: Coded expression for the species

searchParam.name: status
searchParam.documentation: The status of this administrable product. Enables tracking the life-cycle of the content.

searchParam.name: identifier
searchParam.documentation: Persistent identifier for the bundle

searchParam.name: composition
searchParam.documentation: The first resource in the bundle, if the bundle type is "document" - this is a composition, and this parameter provides access to search its contents

searchParam.name: message
searchParam.documentation: The first resource in the bundle, if the bundle type is "message" - this is a message header, and this parameter provides access to search its contents

searchParam.name: type
searchParam.documentation: document | message | transaction | transaction-response | batch | batch-response | history | searchset | collection | subscription-notification

searchParam.name: timestamp
searchParam.documentation: When the bundle was assembled

searchParam.name: date
searchParam.documentation: The capability statement publication date

searchParam.name: resource-profile
searchParam.documentation: A profile id invoked in a capability statement

searchParam.name: context-type-value
searchParam.documentation: A use context type and value assigned to the capability statement

searchParam.name: software
searchParam.documentation: Part of the name of a software application

searchParam.name: resource
searchParam.documentation: Name of a resource mentioned in a capability statement

searchParam.name: jurisdiction
searchParam.documentation: Intended jurisdiction for the capability statement

searchParam.name: format
searchParam.documentation: formats supported (xml | json | ttl | mime type)

searchParam.name: description
searchParam.documentation: The description of the capability statement

searchParam.name: context-type
searchParam.documentation: A type of use context assigned to the capability statement

searchParam.name: fhirversion
searchParam.documentation: The version of FHIR

searchParam.name: title
searchParam.documentation: The human-friendly name of the capability statement

searchParam.name: version
searchParam.documentation: The business version of the capability statement

searchParam.name: supported-profile
searchParam.documentation: Profiles for use cases supported

searchParam.name: url
searchParam.documentation: The uri that identifies the capability statement

searchParam.name: mode
searchParam.documentation: Mode - restful (server/client) or messaging (sender/receiver)

searchParam.name: context-quantity
searchParam.documentation: A quantity- or range-valued use context assigned to the capability statement

searchParam.name: security-service
searchParam.documentation: OAuth | SMART-on-FHIR | NTLM | Basic | Kerberos | Certificates

searchParam.name: context
searchParam.documentation: A use context assigned to the capability statement

searchParam.name: name
searchParam.documentation: Computationally friendly name of the capability statement

searchParam.name: publisher
searchParam.documentation: Name of the publisher of the capability statement

searchParam.name: context-type-quantity
searchParam.documentation: A use context type and quantity- or range-based value assigned to the capability statement

searchParam.name: guide
searchParam.documentation: Implementation guides supported

searchParam.name: status
searchParam.documentation: The current status of the capability statement

searchParam.name: contraindication-reference
searchParam.documentation: The situation that is being documented as contraindicating against this item, as a reference

searchParam.name: identifier
searchParam.documentation: Business identifier for this issue

searchParam.name: indication-reference
searchParam.documentation: The situation that is being documented as an indicaton for this item, as a reference

searchParam.name: product
searchParam.documentation: The medicinal product for which this is a clinical usage issue

searchParam.name: subject
searchParam.documentation: The resource for which this is a clinical usage issue

searchParam.name: effect
searchParam.documentation: The situation in which the undesirable effect may manifest, as a code

searchParam.name: interaction
searchParam.documentation: The type of the interaction e.g. drug-drug interaction, drug-food interaction, drug-lab test interaction

searchParam.name: indication
searchParam.documentation: The situation that is being documented as an indicaton for this item, as a code

searchParam.name: type
searchParam.documentation: indication | contraindication | interaction | undesirable-effect | warning

searchParam.name: contraindication
searchParam.documentation: The situation that is being documented as contraindicating against this item, as a code

searchParam.name: effect-reference
searchParam.documentation: The situation in which the undesirable effect may manifest, as a reference

searchParam.name: status
searchParam.documentation: Whether this is a current issue or one that has been retired etc

searchParam.name: date
searchParam.documentation: Composition editing time

searchParam.name: identifier
searchParam.documentation: Version-independent identifier for the Composition

searchParam.name: period
searchParam.documentation: The period covered by the documentation

searchParam.name: author
searchParam.documentation: Who and/or what authored the composition

searchParam.name: subject
searchParam.documentation: Who and/or what the composition is about

searchParam.name: section
searchParam.documentation: Classification of section (recommended)

searchParam.name: encounter
searchParam.documentation: Context of the Composition

searchParam.name: title
searchParam.documentation: Human Readable name/title

searchParam.name: type
searchParam.documentation: Kind of composition (LOINC if possible)

searchParam.name: version
searchParam.documentation: The business version of the activity definition

searchParam.name: attester
searchParam.documentation: Who attested the composition

searchParam.name: url
searchParam.documentation: The uri that identifies the activity definition

searchParam.name: section-text
searchParam.documentation: Search on the section narrative of the resource

searchParam.name: entry
searchParam.documentation: A reference to data that supports this section

searchParam.name: related
searchParam.documentation: Target of the relationship

searchParam.name: patient
searchParam.documentation: Who and/or what the composition is about

searchParam.name: context
searchParam.documentation: Code(s) that apply to the event being documented

searchParam.name: category
searchParam.documentation: Categorization of Composition

searchParam.name: section-code-text
searchParam.documentation: Search on the section narrative of the resource

searchParam.name: status
searchParam.documentation: preliminary | final | amended | entered-in-error

searchParam.name: substance-definition
searchParam.documentation: Reference to a resource (by instance)

searchParam.name: identifier
searchParam.documentation: An identifier or code by which the ingredient can be referenced

searchParam.name: role
searchParam.documentation: A classification of the ingredient identifying its purpose within the product, e.g. active, inactive

searchParam.name: function
searchParam.documentation: A classification of the ingredient identifying its precise purpose(s) in the drug product. This extends the Ingredient.role to add more detail. Example: Antioxidant, Alkalizing Agent

searchParam.name: substance
searchParam.documentation: Reference to a resource (by instance)

searchParam.name: for
searchParam.documentation: The product which this ingredient is a constituent part of

searchParam.name: substance-code
searchParam.documentation: Reference to a concept (by class)

searchParam.name: manufacturer
searchParam.documentation: The organization that manufactures this ingredient

searchParam.name: status
searchParam.documentation: The status of this ingredient. Enables tracking the life-cycle of the content

searchParam.name: identifier
searchParam.documentation: Unique identifier

searchParam.name: ingredient
searchParam.documentation: An ingredient of this item

searchParam.name: name
searchParam.documentation: A descriptive name applied to this item

searchParam.name: dose-form
searchParam.documentation: Dose form as manufactured and before any transformation into the pharmaceutical product

searchParam.name: status
searchParam.documentation: The status of this item. Enables tracking the life-cycle of the content.

Implemented per the specification (or Insert other doco here)
Implemented per the specification (or Insert other doco here)

searchParam.name: identifier
searchParam.documentation: Business identifier for this product. Could be an MPID

searchParam.name: ingredient
searchParam.documentation: An ingredient of this product

searchParam.name: master-file
searchParam.documentation: A master file for to the medicinal product (e.g. Pharmacovigilance System Master File)

searchParam.name: contact
searchParam.documentation: A product specific contact, person (in a role), or an organization

searchParam.name: domain
searchParam.documentation: If this medicine applies to human or veterinary uses

searchParam.name: name
searchParam.documentation: The full product name

searchParam.name: name-language
searchParam.documentation: Language code for this name

searchParam.name: type
searchParam.documentation: Regulatory type, e.g. Investigational or Authorized

searchParam.name: characteristic
searchParam.documentation: Allows the key product features to be recorded, such as "sugar free", "modified release", "parallel import"

searchParam.name: characteristic-type
searchParam.documentation: A category for the characteristic

searchParam.name: product-classification
searchParam.documentation: Allows the product to be classified by various systems

searchParam.name: status
searchParam.documentation: The status within the lifecycle of this product record. A high-level status, this is not intended to duplicate details carried elsewhere such as legal status, or authorization status

searchParam.name: identifier
searchParam.documentation: Any identifier for the organization (not the accreditation issuer's identifier)

searchParam.name: partof
searchParam.documentation: An organization of which this organization forms a part

searchParam.name: address
searchParam.documentation: A server defined search that may match any of the string fields in the Address, including line, city, district, state, country, postalCode, and/or text

searchParam.name: address-state
searchParam.documentation: A state specified in an address

searchParam.name: active
searchParam.documentation: Is the Organization record active

searchParam.name: type
searchParam.documentation: A code for the type of organization

searchParam.name: address-postalcode
searchParam.documentation: A postal code specified in an address

searchParam.name: address-country
searchParam.documentation: A country specified in an address

searchParam.name: endpoint
searchParam.documentation: Technical endpoints providing access to services operated for the organization

searchParam.name: phonetic
searchParam.documentation: A portion of the organization's name using some kind of phonetic matching algorithm

searchParam.name: address-use
searchParam.documentation: A use code specified in an address

searchParam.name: name
searchParam.documentation: A portion of the organization's name or alias

searchParam.name: address-city
searchParam.documentation: A city specified in an address

searchParam.name: identifier
searchParam.documentation: Unique identifier

searchParam.name: manufactured-item
searchParam.documentation: A manufactured item of medication within this packaged product

searchParam.name: nutrition
searchParam.documentation: A nutrition product within this packaged product

searchParam.name: package
searchParam.documentation: A complete packaged product within this packaged product

searchParam.name: name
searchParam.documentation: A name for this package. Typically what it would be listed as in a drug formulary or catalogue, inventory etc

searchParam.name: biological
searchParam.documentation: A biologically derived product within this packaged product

searchParam.name: package-for
searchParam.documentation: The product that this is a pack for

searchParam.name: contained-item
searchParam.documentation: Any of the contained items within this packaged product

searchParam.name: medication
searchParam.documentation: A manufactured item of medication within this packaged product

searchParam.name: device
searchParam.documentation: A device within this packaged product

searchParam.name: status
searchParam.documentation: The status within the lifecycle of this item. A high level status, this is not intended to duplicate details carried elsewhere such as legal status, or authorization or marketing status

searchParam.name: identifier
searchParam.documentation: Business identifier for the authorization, typically assigned by the authorizing body

searchParam.name: subject
searchParam.documentation: The type of regulated product, treatment, facility or activity that is being authorized

searchParam.name: case-type
searchParam.documentation: The defining type of case

searchParam.name: holder
searchParam.documentation: The organization that holds the granted authorization

searchParam.name: region
searchParam.documentation: The territory (e.g., country, jurisdiction etc.) in which the authorization has been granted

searchParam.name: case
searchParam.documentation: The case or procedure number

searchParam.name: status
searchParam.documentation: The status that is authorised e.g. approved. Intermediate states can be tracked with cases and applications

searchParam.name: identifier
searchParam.documentation: Identifier by which this substance is known

searchParam.name: code
searchParam.documentation: The specific code

searchParam.name: domain
searchParam.documentation: If the substance applies to only human or veterinary use

searchParam.name: name
searchParam.documentation: The actual name

searchParam.name: classification
searchParam.documentation: High or low level categorization, e.g. polymer vs. nucleic acid or linear vs. branch chain

searchParam.name: _id
searchParam.documentation: Searches on the server assigned id

searchParam.name: _list
searchParam.documentation: Retrieval of resources that are referenced by a List resource

searchParam.name: _has
searchParam.documentation: Provides support for reverse chaining

searchParam.name: _type
searchParam.documentation: Type of resource (when doing cross-resource search

searchParam.name: _sort
searchParam.documentation: How to sort the resources when returning

searchParam.name: _count
searchParam.documentation: How many resources to return

searchParam.name: _include
searchParam.documentation: Control over returning additional resources (see spec)

searchParam.name: _revinclude
searchParam.documentation: Control over returning additional resources (see spec)

searchParam.name: _elements
searchParam.documentation: What kind of information to return

searchParam.name: _language
searchParam.documentation: Language of the resource content

searchParam.name: _in
searchParam.documentation: Allows for the retrieval of resources that are active members of a CareTeam, Group, or List

searchParam.name: _lastUpdated
searchParam.documentation: When the resource version last changed

searchParam.name: _profile
searchParam.documentation: Profiles this resource claims to conform to
